title: (x) vintage looking watch dial numerals - various {gang}
content:
Hi, I've been asked to create a watch dial with a font similar to this vintage looking Glycine watch?   
   
Many thanks for your help in advance, Kent   
I use a macintosh for creating my dial prototypes.   
 ![Glycine watchface](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124252im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28892.jpg)
author: watchmakerkent

comments.content: The brand name could be faked with [Interstate](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124252/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/), maybe. The dial numerals look vaguely [Metropolitain](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124252/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/metropolitain/ef/testdrive.html?s=123456789&p=48)-esque.

I think the odds are against the use of a font for the watchface in your sample, but if you need a font starting point the numerals of [Poor Richard](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124252/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/poor-richard-rr/monoline/testdrive.html?s=1234567890&p=48) are somewhat similar, particularly the 2.
